userStories.title: Add API keys database schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store API keys in the database for authentication.
acceptanceCriteria: Create api_keys table with columns: id, name, key_hash, scopes (array), expires_at (nullable), created_at, updated_at
Key hash uses bcrypt or argon2
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/001_create_api_keys.sql. Added argon2-cffi dependency.

userStories.title: Implement API key generation and hashing
userStories.description: As a developer, I need functions to generate and hash API keys.
acceptanceCriteria: Function to generate cryptographically secure API key (32+ bytes)
Function to hash API key using bcrypt/argon2
Function to verify API key against hash
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/api_keys.py with argon2 hashing. 17 unit tests in tests/unit/test_api_keys.py.

userStories.title: Add authentication middleware
userStories.description: As a developer, I need middleware to authenticate API requests using API keys.
acceptanceCriteria: Middleware extracts API key from Authorization header (Bearer token)
Returns 401 for invalid/missing keys, 403 for insufficient scopes
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/auth_middleware.py. 35 unit tests in tests/unit/test_auth_middleware.py. Includes decorator and function-based auth, scope checking, expiration validation, and health endpoint bypass.

userStories.title: Add Prometheus metrics for auth failures
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to monitor authentication failures.
acceptanceCriteria: Counter metric: medic_auth_failures_total with labels (reason: invalid_key, expired_key, insufficient_scope)
Metric incremented on each auth failure
userStories.notes: Added AUTH_FAILURES counter in Medic/Core/metrics.py with record_auth_failure() helper. Integrated into auth_middleware.py for all failure cases.

userStories.title: Add rate limiting infrastructure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need rate limiting backend infrastructure.
acceptanceCriteria: Rate limiter interface supporting in-memory and Redis backends
Default limits: 100 req/min heartbeats, 20 req/min management
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/rate_limiter.py with RateLimiter ABC, InMemoryRateLimiter (sliding window), and RedisRateLimiter placeholder. 29 unit tests in tests/unit/test_rate_limiter.py.

userStories.title: Add rate limiting middleware
userStories.description: As a developer, I need middleware to enforce rate limits.
acceptanceCriteria: Middleware checks rate limit before processing request
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/rate_limit_middleware.py with @rate_limit() decorator. 29 unit tests in tests/unit/test_rate_limit_middleware.py. Supports auto-detection of heartbeat vs management endpoints, custom configs, and falls back to IP-based rate limiting for unauthenticated requests.

userStories.title: Add webhooks database schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store webhook configurations in the database.
acceptanceCriteria: Create webhooks table with columns: id, service_id (nullable for global), url, headers (jsonb), enabled, created_at, updated_at
Create webhook_deliveries table: id, webhook_id, payload, status, attempts, last_attempt_at, response_code, response_body
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/002_create_webhooks.sql. Tables use JSONB for headers and payload. URL validation via regex constraint. Foreign key to services with ON DELETE CASCADE.

userStories.title: Implement webhook delivery service
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a service to deliver webhook notifications.
acceptanceCriteria: Service sends POST request to webhook URL with JSON payload
Custom headers from webhook config included
Delivery status tracked in webhook_deliveries table
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/webhook_delivery.py with WebhookDeliveryService class. 41 unit tests in tests/unit/test_webhook_delivery.py. Supports POST with JSON, custom headers, exponential backoff (1s, 5s, 30s), and delivery tracking.

userStories.title: Add teams database schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store team configurations for alert routing.
acceptanceCriteria: Create teams table with columns: id, name, slack_channel_id, created_at, updated_at
Add team_id column to services table (nullable, foreign key)
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/003_create_teams.sql. Teams table includes team_id, name, slack_channel_id, timestamps. Services table gets team_id FK with ON DELETE SET NULL.

userStories.title: Implement team-based alert routing
userStories.description: As a developer, I need alert routing to use team Slack channels.
acceptanceCriteria: Alert routing checks service's team first
Falls back to default channel if no team or team has no channel
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/alert_routing.py with get_slack_channel_for_service() and get_team_for_service(). 19 unit tests in tests/unit/test_alert_routing.py. Checks team's Slack channel first, falls back to default SLACK_CHANNEL_ID.

userStories.title: Add notification targets schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store multiple notification targets per service.
acceptanceCriteria: Create notification_targets table: id, service_id, type (slack, pagerduty, webhook), config (jsonb), priority, enabled
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/004_create_notification_targets.sql. Table includes target_id, service_id, type (slack/pagerduty/webhook), config (jsonb), priority, enabled, timestamps. Indexes on service_id, enabled, type, and composite service+priority.

userStories.title: Implement flexible alert routing logic
userStories.description: As a developer, I need alert routing to support multiple targets with modes.
acceptanceCriteria: Support 'notify_all' mode: send to all targets
Support 'notify_until_success' mode: stop after first successful delivery
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/alert_routing.py. Added NotificationMode and NotificationType enums, NotificationTarget and NotificationResult dataclasses, route_alert() with notify_all and notify_until_success modes, get_notification_targets_for_service(), and helper functions. 36 new unit tests (55 total) in tests/unit/test_alert_routing.py.

userStories.title: Add working hours schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store working hours schedules.
acceptanceCriteria: Create schedules table: id, name, timezone (IANA format), hours (jsonb for day/hour ranges)
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/005_create_schedules.sql. Table includes schedule_id, name (unique), timezone (IANA format with CHECK constraint), hours (JSONB for day/hour ranges), timestamps. Services table gets schedule_id FK with ON DELETE SET NULL.

userStories.title: Implement working hours evaluation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to evaluate if current time is within working hours.
acceptanceCriteria: Function to check if given time is within schedule's working hours
Unit tests for DST edge cases pass
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/working_hours.py with is_within_working_hours(), get_schedule_for_service(), get_current_period(). Uses zoneinfo for proper IANA timezone support and DST handling. 47 unit tests in tests/unit/test_working_hours.py covering DST transitions, leap years, edge cases.

userStories.title: Add working hours to alert routing
userStories.description: As a developer, I need alert routing to respect working hours.
acceptanceCriteria: Service config supports separate routing for during_hours and after_hours
Alert routing uses correct targets based on current time and schedule
userStories.notes: Added period column to notification_targets table (always/during_hours/after_hours) via migration 006. Implemented route_alert_with_schedule() in Medic/Core/alert_routing.py that uses get_service_current_period() from working_hours module to select appropriate targets. 24 new unit tests (79 total) in tests/unit/test_alert_routing.py.

userStories.title: Add maintenance windows schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store maintenance window definitions.
acceptanceCriteria: Create maintenance_windows table: id, name, start_time, end_time, recurrence (cron, nullable), timezone, service_ids (array, empty = all), created_at
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/007_create_maintenance_windows.sql. Table includes window_id, name (unique), start_time, end_time, recurrence (cron, nullable), timezone (IANA format with CHECK), service_ids (integer array), timestamps. Indexes on name, time range, service_ids (GIN), and recurrence.

userStories.title: Implement maintenance window evaluation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to check if a service is in a maintenance window.
acceptanceCriteria: Function to check if service is currently in maintenance window
Supports recurring windows via cron expression
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/maintenance_windows.py. Primary function is_service_in_maintenance() checks if service is in active window. Supports one-time and recurring (cron) windows with timezone/DST handling. 57 unit tests in tests/unit/test_maintenance_windows.py.

userStories.title: Suppress alerts during maintenance windows
userStories.description: As an operator, I want alerts suppressed during maintenance windows.
acceptanceCriteria: Alert checker skips services in active maintenance window
Logs indicate alert was suppressed due to maintenance
userStories.notes: Integrated is_service_in_maintenance() check in Medic/Worker/monitor.py queryForNoHeartbeat(). Suppresses new alerts when service is in maintenance window with logging. 5 new unit tests in tests/unit/test_monitor.py. Recovery alerts still sent during maintenance.

userStories.title: Add start/complete signal statuses
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to track job start and completion signals.
acceptanceCriteria: Add status enum values: STARTED, COMPLETED, FAILED to heartbeat status
Add run_id column to heartbeats table (nullable, for correlating start/complete)
userStories.notes: Added HeartbeatStatus enum with STARTED/COMPLETED/FAILED values in Medic/Helpers/heartbeat.py. Migration 008 adds run_id column to heartbeatEvents table with indexes. Heartbeat class updated to support run_id parameter. 21 unit tests in tests/unit/test_heartbeat.py.

userStories.title: Implement start/complete signal API endpoints
userStories.description: As a developer, I need API endpoints for start/complete signals.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /v2/heartbeat/:id/start - records STARTED status with optional run_id
POST /v2/heartbeat/:id/complete - records COMPLETED status with optional run_id
POST /v2/heartbeat/:id/fail - records FAILED status with optional run_id
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/routes.py with three v2 endpoints (/v2/heartbeat/:id/start, /complete, /fail). Helper function _record_job_signal() handles validation, optional run_id parsing, and response formatting. 10 integration tests in tests/integration/test_api.py.

userStories.title: Add duration tracking to services
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to track job duration statistics.
acceptanceCriteria: Store duration for each completed run (end_time - start_time)
Add max_duration column to services table
Create job_runs table: id, service_id, run_id, started_at, completed_at, duration_ms, status
userStories.notes: Migration 009 creates medic.job_runs table and adds max_duration_ms to services. Medic/Core/job_runs.py implements duration tracking with record_job_start(), record_job_completion(). Routes.py integrates job_runs tracking in V2 signal endpoints. 25 unit tests in tests/unit/test_job_runs.py.

userStories.title: Implement duration statistics API
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an API to retrieve duration statistics.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /v2/services/:id/stats returns avg, p50, p95, p99 duration from last 100 runs
Returns empty stats if fewer than 5 runs
userStories.notes: Implemented GET /v2/services/:id/stats endpoint in routes.py. Added DurationStatistics dataclass and get_duration_statistics() function with percentile calculations in job_runs.py. 20 unit tests + 5 integration tests added.

userStories.title: Alert on duration threshold exceeded
userStories.description: As an operator, I want alerts when jobs exceed max duration.
acceptanceCriteria: Alert triggered when COMPLETED duration exceeds service's max_duration
Alert triggered when STARTED job has no COMPLETED after max_duration
userStories.notes: Implemented DurationAlert dataclass, check_duration_threshold() for completed jobs, get_stale_runs_exceeding_max_duration() for hung jobs. Integrated with routes.py V2 completion endpoints and monitor.py worker. Added Prometheus metrics: medic_duration_alerts_total, medic_stale_jobs_current. 25 new unit tests in tests/unit/test_job_runs.py.

userStories.title: Add grace periods to services
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to support grace periods for heartbeat checks.
acceptanceCriteria: Add grace_period_seconds column to services table
Alert checker waits grace_period after missed heartbeat before alerting
userStories.notes: Migration 010 adds grace_period_seconds column to services table. Monitor.py checks grace period before alerting - computes required_delay = interval + grace_period and delays alert if time_since_last < required_delay. 8 new unit tests in tests/unit/test_monitor.py.

userStories.title: Add playbooks database schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store playbook definitions in the database.
acceptanceCriteria: Create playbooks table: id, name, description, yaml_content, version, created_at, updated_at
Create playbook_triggers table: id, playbook_id, service_pattern, consecutive_failures, enabled
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/011_create_playbooks.sql. Tables: medic.playbooks (playbook_id, name, description, yaml_content, version, timestamps) and medic.playbook_triggers (trigger_id, playbook_id, service_pattern, consecutive_failures, enabled, timestamps). Includes FK constraint with CASCADE delete, appropriate indexes for lookups and trigger matching.

userStories.title: Implement playbook YAML parser
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to parse playbook YAML definitions.
acceptanceCriteria: Parse playbook YAML into typed structure
Support step types: webhook, script, wait, condition
Support approval settings: none, required, timeout:Xm
Validate required fields and step structure
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/playbook_parser.py. StepType enum (webhook, script, wait, condition), ApprovalMode enum (none, required, timeout:Xm), dataclasses for each step type and Playbook, parse_playbook_yaml() with validation. 63 unit tests in tests/unit/test_playbook_parser.py.

userStories.title: Add playbook executions tracking
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to track playbook execution state.
acceptanceCriteria: Create playbook_executions table: id, playbook_id, service_id, status (pending_approval, running, waiting, completed, failed, cancelled), current_step, started_at, completed_at
Create playbook_step_results table: id, execution_id, step_name, status, output, started_at, completed_at
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/012_create_playbook_executions.sql. Tables: medic.playbook_executions (execution_id, playbook_id, service_id, status, current_step, started_at, completed_at, timestamps) and medic.playbook_step_results (result_id, execution_id, step_name, step_index, status, output, error_message, started_at, completed_at, timestamps). Includes FK constraints with CASCADE delete and appropriate indexes for common queries.

userStories.title: Implement playbook execution engine core
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an engine to execute playbook steps.
acceptanceCriteria: State persisted after each step (survives restart)
Support for wait step (pause execution for duration)
userStories.notes: Implemented in Medic/Core/playbook_engine.py. PlaybookExecutionEngine class with sequential step processing, state persistence to database, wait step support. ExecutionStatus and StepResultStatus enums. Placeholder executors for webhook/script/condition steps. 50 unit tests in tests/unit/test_playbook_engine.py.

userStories.title: Implement webhook step executor
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to execute webhook steps in playbooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Execute HTTP request with configured method, URL, headers, body
Step result includes response code and body
userStories.notes: Implemented execute_webhook_step() in Medic/Core/playbook_engine.py. Supports variable substitution (${SERVICE_NAME}, ${SERVICE_ID}, ${ALERT_ID}, ${RUN_ID}, ${EXECUTION_ID}, ${PLAYBOOK_NAME}), configurable success_codes, response truncation. substitute_variables() handles strings/dicts/lists. _build_webhook_context() fetches service name from DB. 20 new webhook tests (70 total) in tests/unit/test_playbook_engine.py.

userStories.title: Add registered scripts schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store pre-registered scripts for execution.
acceptanceCriteria: Create registered_scripts table: id, name, content, interpreter (bash, python), timeout_seconds, created_at
userStories.notes: Migration created in migrations/013_create_registered_scripts.sql. Table includes script_id, name (unique), content, interpreter (bash/python with CHECK), timeout_seconds (positive with CHECK), timestamps. Indexes on name, interpreter, and created_at.

userStories.title: Implement script step executor
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to execute script steps in playbooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Execute only pre-registered scripts by name
Sandboxed execution with resource limits (timeout, memory)

userStories.title: Implement condition step executor
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to execute condition steps in playbooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Support check type: heartbeat_received (verify service received heartbeat)

userStories.title: Implement playbook trigger matching
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to match alerts to playbook triggers.
acceptanceCriteria: Match service name against trigger's service_pattern (glob pattern)

userStories.title: Integrate playbook triggering with alerts
userStories.description: As an operator, I want playbooks to trigger automatically on alerts.
acceptanceCriteria: When alert fires, check for matching playbook
If match found and approval=none, start execution immediately
If match found and approval=required, create pending_approval execution

userStories.title: Add approval requests tracking
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to track approval requests for playbooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Create approval_requests table: id, execution_id, requested_at, expires_at, status (pending, approved, rejected, expired), decided_by, decided_at

userStories.title: Implement Slack approval buttons
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to approve/reject playbooks via Slack buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Send Slack message with Accept/Decline interactive buttons
Update approval_request status on button click

userStories.title: Add circuit breaker for playbook executions
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to prevent runaway playbook executions.
acceptanceCriteria: Track execution count per service in sliding window (1 hour)
Block new executions if service exceeds threshold (default 5/hour)
Log and alert when circuit breaker trips

userStories.title: Add playbook execution Prometheus metrics
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to monitor playbook execution metrics.

userStories.title: Add remediation audit log schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store remediation audit logs.
acceptanceCriteria: Create remediation_audit_log table: id, execution_id, action_type, details (jsonb), actor, timestamp
Action types: execution_started, step_completed, step_failed, approval_requested, approved, rejected, execution_completed, execution_failed

userStories.title: Implement audit logging in execution engine
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the execution engine to write audit logs.
acceptanceCriteria: Log entry created for each action type during execution
Includes full context in details field

userStories.title: Add audit log query API
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to query and export audit logs.
acceptanceCriteria: GET /v2/audit-logs with filters: execution_id, service_id, action_type, date range
Export formats: JSON, CSV via Accept header

userStories.title: Add API endpoint to trigger playbooks
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to trigger playbooks via API.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /v2/playbooks/:id/execute with optional service_id and variables
Rate limiting applied (10 req/min per API key)

userStories.title: Add webhook endpoint to trigger playbooks
userStories.description: As an external system, I want to trigger playbooks via webhook.
acceptanceCriteria: Authenticate via webhook secret in header

userStories.title: Add secrets encryption for playbooks
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to encrypt secrets used in playbooks.
acceptanceCriteria: Create secrets table: id, name, encrypted_value, created_at
Encrypt using AES-256-GCM with server key
